Hank Mitchell.Action: Coughs and spits into the snow after emerging from dusty mill, then quickly leaves, showing consideration for cleanliness and others' comfort.
Quietly deposits paperwork on boss’s desk without interrupting or drawing attention, respects workspace and social boundaries.
Hesitates when leaving office, possibly showing respect or consideration for boss or situation.
Tallying bags on a clipboard methodically in a dusty feed mill environment.

Greets neighbors warmly and acknowledges people in his community, demonstrating social awareness and situational confidence.
Navigates the rundown town and interacts with environment calmly and appropriately.
Waits quietly and listens to his pregnant wife singing in the shower before gently offering her a towel without speaking, sharing a silent moment of intimacy and care.
Sarah adjusts his collar and hums cheerfully, Hank shows dismay and lack of enthusiasm when waving back to Lou.

Calmly prepares for the day (knotting his tie, changing into a dark suit), attempts to maintain composure despite dismay.
Questions why Lou is coming along but then checks himself and refrains from protesting further.
Shows lack of enthusiasm in waving back to Lou, hinting at low confidence or unease.

Tells Jacob not to hunt on posted nature preserve land, showing concern for rules and safety.

Allows himself to be tickled and teased by Lou and Jacob, enduring playful roughhousing without anger.
Does not retaliate or respond aggressively despite being physically overwhelmed and hurt (hit by bird, bleeding forehead).

Agrees to Lou’s demand to count the money first despite previous hesitation, indicating flexibility and willingness to negotiate.
